case_vignette: A 61-year-old man presents to the primary care clinic to establish care. He has not seen a physician for many years. He has no complaints or concerns but, on further questioning, does have some vague abdominal discomfort. He has no known past medical history and takes no medications. His social history is notable for injecting heroin throughout his late-teens and 20s, but he has been clean and sober for over a decade. At the clinic, the vital signs include: heart rate 90/min, respiratory rate 17/min, blood pressure 110/65 mm Hg, and temperature 37.0°C (98.6°F). The physical exam shows a slightly distended abdomen. The laboratory studies are notable for a platelet count of 77,000/uL and an international normalized ratio (INR) of 1.7.
question: Which  is the next best step in the diagnosis of this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have some vague abdominal discomfort.
Have you had any changes in your appetite or weight?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, I haven't made any recent changes to my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been exposed to new environments.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your daily routine?
No, I have not had any stressful events or changes in my daily routine.
Have you had any recent illnesses or injuries?
No, I have not had any recent illnesses or injuries.
Have you had any family history of gastrointestinal disorders?
I don't know of any past medical history.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I take no medications.
Final Diagnosis: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
